fields.lore: Raijin Thunderkeg's duality allows him to admire himself in shocking fashion.
fields.description: Creates an explosively charged image of Storm Spirit that lasts 12 seconds and will detonate and deal damage if an enemy unit comes near it.
fields.name: Static Remnant
fields.notes: Remnants take 1 second to materialize after the spell is cast. Remnants grant flying vision for their duration. The explosion actually hits units in a 260 radius, but will only be triggered in 235.

fields.lore: Pow!  Zip!  Zap!
fields.description: Casting a spell creates an electrical charge, which is released in a burst on his next attack, dealing damage and slowing nearby enemies.
fields.name: Overload
fields.notes: Using items doesn't trigger Overload.

fields.lore: Pow!  Zip!  Zap!
fields.description: Casting a spell creates an electrical charge, which is released in a burst on his next attack, dealing damage and slowing nearby enemies.
fields.name: Overload
fields.notes: Using items doesn't trigger Overload.

fields.lore: Raijin's thunderous, boisterous energy often draws others into an electrifying situation.
fields.description: A vortex that pulls an enemy unit to Storm Spirit's location, it also slows the Storm Spirit by 50% for 3 seconds.
fields.name: Electric Vortex

fields.lore: Pow!  Zip!  Zap!
fields.description: Casting a spell creates an electrical charge, which is released in a burst on his next attack, dealing damage and slowing nearby enemies.
fields.name: Overload
fields.notes: Using items doesn't trigger Overload.

fields.lore: The Storm is coming in.
fields.description: Storm Spirit becomes volatile electricity, charging across the battlefield until he depletes his mana or reaches his target. The mana activation cost is 15+7% of his total mana pool, and the cost per 100 units traveled is 10+1% of his total mana pool.  Damage is expressed in damage per 100 units traveled.
fields.name: Ball Lightning
fields.notes: Instant cast abilities can be used while traveling. This ability will destroy trees. Storm Spirit is invulnerable during Ball Lightning.

fields.description: A vortex that pulls an enemy unit to Storm Spirit's location, it also slows the Storm Spirit by 50% for 3 seconds.
fields.name: Electric Vortex

fields.lore: The Storm is coming in.
fields.description: Storm Spirit becomes volatile electricity, charging across the battlefield until he depletes his mana or reaches his target. The mana activation cost is 15+7% of his total mana pool, and the cost per 100 units traveled is 10+1% of his total mana pool.  Damage is expressed in damage per 100 units traveled.
fields.name: Ball Lightning
fields.notes: Instant cast abilities can be used while traveling. This ability will destroy trees. Storm Spirit is invulnerable during Ball Lightning.

fields.lore: Lucifer's appetite and greed are never sated.
fields.description: Consumes an enemy or neutral creep, acquiring any special abilities that it possessed.
fields.name: Devour
fields.notes: Gives Doom the original bounty of the creep, along with the bonus gold. The amount of time it takes to Devour depends on the current HP of the unit. Doom can't Devour mechanical or ancient units. If you devour a creep without abilities, you'll keep the abilities you had previously.

fields.lore: The Fallen One spreads destruction in his wake, sparing none from the flame which sustains him.
fields.description: Carpets the nearby earth in flames, damaging enemies while Doom gains bonus HP regen and increased movement speed.
fields.name: Scorched Earth
fields.notes: Scorched Earth follows Doom, centered on his location. Other units Doom controls also benefit from Scorched Earth.

fields.lore: When a name is tolled from the bell of Vashundol, doom is sure to follow.
fields.description:
Inflicts a curse that prevents an enemy Hero from casting spells or using items, while taking damage over time.  Doom also disables most passive abilities and removes positive buffs on cast. 

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Doom
fields.notes: Doom damages units through magic immunity. Units afflicted by Doom can be denied when their HP drops below 25%.

fields.lore: Lucifer shares the fire branding bestowed upon him at the time of his exile.
fields.description: Dissipates a piece of an enemy Hero's soul, mini-stunning and dealing bonus damage equal to 20% of the target's maximum health when the enemy's level is a multiple of a specific number or 25.
fields.name: LVL? Death
fields.notes: Interrupts channeling abilities.

fields.lore: In the frozen tundra near the Barrier, after the last sun of autumn has set, ice can form with alarming speed.
fields.description: Tusk compresses shards of ice into a ball of frozen energy that damages all enemies it comes in contact with. If the ball comes in contact with an enemy hero or reaches its maximum range the shards are released, creating a barrier that lasts for 5 seconds.
fields.name: Ice Shards
fields.notes: The maximum distance is 1600. Creates an impassable barrier. The shards destroy trees when they are created.

fields.lore: Tales are still told of the wild feat that ended the grand brawl at White Fields.
fields.description: Tusk and any nearby allied heroes roll in a quickly growing snowball towards the target enemy unit. Any victims caught in the snowball's path take damage and are briefly stunned.  The snowball moves at a percentage of Tusk's current movement speed.
fields.name: Snowball
fields.notes: The snowball moves at 150% of Tusk's movement speed when the ability is cast. The snowball destroys trees. Doesn't carry illusions, but will carry Meepo clones and other units that Tusk controls.

fields.lore: It never matters who throws the first punch, only who throws the last.
fields.description: Tusk prepares his mighty Walrus Punch; his next attack will do a critical strike and launch the victim into the air. The victim will be slowed upon landing and take damage.
fields.name: Walrus PUNCH!
fields.notes: Walrus Punch cannot miss. Works fully on magic immune units.

fields.lore: The chill of home!
fields.description: Tusk summons a Frozen Sigil by calling upon the deepest cold of winter. The Sigil creates a snowstorm which slows all enemy units within 600 range.
fields.name: Frozen Sigil
fields.notes: If no order is given, the Sigil will follow Tusk. The Sigil flies, has a 310 MS, 3/3/4/4 HP, 400/400 vision, and gives a 90/100/110/120 gold bounty. Works fully on magic immune units. Heroes deal 1 damage to the sigil, while non-hero units deal 0.25 damage.

fields.lore: One of the few Dezun rites used for offensive purposes, the paralytic enchantment often proves useful.
fields.description:
Casts a poisonous spell on an enemy unit, causing damage and slowness over time, and eventual paralysis.  Poison Touch mini-stuns on impact. Slow increases per level.

Level 1 slows the target by 33% during the set time.

Level 2 slows the target by 33% for 2 seconds, then by 66% for 1 second.

Level 3 slows the target by 33%, 66%, and 100%, for one second respectively.

Level 4 slows the target by 33%, then slows the target by 66% for 1 second, then stuns the target for 1 second.
fields.name: Poison Touch
fields.notes: The damage is not reduced by damage block abilities. The initial ministun will cancel channeling.

fields.lore: Only a seasoned acolyte of the Shadow can properly perform the rite of preventing death.
fields.description: An ally blessed with Shallow Grave, no matter how close to death, cannot die while under its protection.
fields.name: Shallow Grave
fields.notes: HP cannot go below 1 while under the effects of Shallow Grave, but Axe's Culling Blade will still kill the hero.

fields.lore: One of the few Dezun rites used for offensive purposes, the paralytic enchantment often proves useful.
fields.description:
Casts a poisonous spell on an enemy unit, causing damage and slowness over time, and eventual paralysis.  Poison Touch mini-stuns on impact. Slow increases per level.

Level 1 slows the target by 33% during the set time.

Level 2 slows the target by 33% for 2 seconds, then by 66% for 1 second.

Level 3 slows the target by 33%, 66%, and 100%, for one second respectively.

Level 4 slows the target by 33%, then slows the target by 66% for 1 second, then stuns the target for 1 second.
fields.name: Poison Touch
fields.notes: The damage is not reduced by damage block abilities. The initial ministun will cancel channeling.

fields.lore: While it is a simplistic and routine rite among Shadow Priests, the Shadow Wave is also the most critical for success.
fields.description: Shadow Wave heals several allies, which in turn cause damage equal to their healing in a small area around them.  Dazzle is always healed by Shadow Wave, and it does not count toward the number of targets.
fields.name: Shadow Wave
fields.notes: Prioritizes allied heroes over creeps. If enemies are near multiple allied units affected by Shadow Wave, they can take multiple instances of damage.

fields.lore: One of the few Dezun rites used for offensive purposes, the paralytic enchantment often proves useful.

fields.lore: His ethereal journey into the Nothl realm has allowed Dazzle to mend together the powers of light and dark, creating shifting waves of enchantments.
fields.description:
Applies a buff that increases allied hero armor or decreases enemy hero armor in the target area over time.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Weave
fields.notes: Places a buff on units, so entering or leaving the area after the cast has no effect.

fields.lore: A torrent from the Deep Ones crushes the defenses of the Siren's enemies.
fields.description: The Naga Siren and her images hit all nearby units with a damaging wave of water that lowers armor for 8 seconds.
fields.name: Rip Tide
fields.notes: Naga's illusions will also cast Riptide, but enemies in multiple areas of effect will only be hit once.

fields.lore: Slithice, while being strong in her own right, is notoriously hard to track down.
fields.description: Creates three images of Naga Siren under her control.
fields.name: Mirror Image
fields.notes: Naga Siren is invulnerable for 0.3 seconds when casting, allowing her to dodge stuns and damage. Upon casting, most effects are removed from Naga Siren.

fields.lore: The only way to escape the onslaught of a Slithereen is to never oppose one in the first place.
fields.description: Interrupts the target and traps them in place, preventing movement or blinking.
fields.name: Ensnare
fields.notes: Works on magic immune units. Becoming ethereal removes Ensnare.

fields.lore: A torrent from the Deep Ones crushes the defenses of the Siren's enemies.
fields.description: The Naga Siren and her images hit all nearby units with a damaging wave of water that lowers armor for 8 seconds.
fields.name: Rip Tide

fields.name: Rip Tide
fields.notes: Naga's illusions will also cast Riptide, but enemies in multiple areas of effect will only be hit once.

fields.lore: Slithice's powerful voice enchants leagues of opponents, while calling her Slithereen kin in a time of need.
fields.description: All enemies in range of the Naga Siren are put into a magical stasis where they cannot act or be attacked. Using Song of the Siren again will end the duration early.
fields.name: Song of the Siren
fields.notes: Units affected by Song of the Siren are invulnerable and cannot take damage from any source. Doesn't affect magic immune units. The area of the song follows Naga, so if she moves far enough away from affected units, they will wake up.

fields.description: Allows manipulation of ice elements and grants a permanent strength bonus. Each Quas instance provides increased health regeneration.
fields.name: Quas
fields.notes: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.

fields.lore: So begins a new age of knowledge.
fields.description:
Combines the properties of the elements currently being manipulated, creating a new spell at the Invoker's disposal. Click the help button to see the list of possible spells.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Invoke
fields.notes: The arrangement of instances does not matter.

fields.lore: So begins a new age of knowledge.
fields.description:
Combines the properties of the elements currently being manipulated, creating a new spell at the Invoker's disposal. Click the help button to see the list of possible spells.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Invoke
fields.notes: The arrangement of instances does not matter.

fields.description: Allows manipulation of fire elements and grants a permanent intelligence bonus. Each Exort instance provides increased attack damage.
fields.name: Exort
fields.notes: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.

fields.lore: Using traditional Alchemy from the Darkbrew family, Razzil concocts an acid that dissolves even the toughest metals.
fields.description: Sprays high-pressure acid across a target area. Enemy units who step across the contaminated terrain take mixed damage per second and have their armor reduced.
fields.name: Acid Spray
fields.notes: Hits magic immune units.

fields.lore: A silver lining to the failure of turning a mountain into gold, this volatile solution has destructive potential.
fields.description: Alchemist brews up an unstable concoction that he can throw at an enemy hero, to stun and deal damage in an area around the explosion. The longer the concoction brews, the more damage it deals and the longer the stun. After 5 seconds, the brew reaches its maximum damage and stun time. However, after 5.5 seconds, the concoction will explode on Alchemist himself if not thrown.
fields.name: Unstable Concoction
fields.notes: Alchemist can move and act normally while brewing. A timer above Alchemist's head will indicate the remaining brew time. Maximum effects are achieved after 5 seconds. You can deny yourself with this skill. Unstable Concoction cannot be disjointed.

fields.lore: The brew Razzil gave to the Ogre during their prison bust has become a useful potion in the midst of combat.
fields.description: Alchemist causes his Ogre to enter a chemically induced rage, reducing base attack cooldown and increasing movement speed and regeneration.
fields.name: Chemical Rage
fields.notes: Has a 0.35 second transformation time, which can be used to dodge projectiles and stuns.

fields.lore: While it is not a mountain, Razzil has mastered the conversion of smaller compounds to line his pockets.
fields.description: Alchemist gets bonus gold for killing creeps; the bonus stacks if the creeps are killed within a period of time, after which the count is reset.  The bonus gold is capped at 30 gold.
fields.name: Greevil's Greed

fields.lore: Mt. Joerlak was a somewhat unstable mass, and Magnus has learned to channel its reverberations.
fields.description: Magnus sends out a wave of force, damaging enemy units in a line.
fields.name: Shockwave

fields.lore: Magnoceros horns are valuable in direct proportion to their danger to prospective merchants.
fields.description: Magnus rushes forward, goring enemy units on his massive tusk.  Heroes hit on the way will be dragged to the destination, then damaged and slowed.
fields.name: Skewer
fields.notes: Doesn't affect magic immune units.

fields.name: Shockwave

fields.lore: Magnus fights with the fury of the erupting Mt. Joerlak.
fields.description: Magnus changes properties of matter, sucking all nearby enemies in front of him and stunning them with a powerful slam and dealing damage.
fields.name: Reverse Polarity
fields.notes: Disable and pull work through magic immunity.

fields.lore: With a deep bellow, Magnus displays his true power.
fields.description: Gives an allied unit bonus damage and cleave on attack.
fields.name: Empower
fields.notes: The bonus damage is based only on base damage and damage from primary attributes. Cleave damage is reduced by armor type but not by armor value. Cleave damage goes through magic immunity. Ranged units cannot Cleave.

fields.lore: A true steward of the forest, Aiushtha befriends all within it - from lowly trolls to powerful centaurs.
fields.description: Enchantress charms an enemy, bringing it under her control (if a creep) or slowing it (if a hero).
fields.name: Enchant
fields.notes: Illusions can be converted.

fields.lore: Whimsical spirits of the woods possess a healing power that is quite subtle, but gains strength in numbers.
fields.description: A cloud of wisps heals Enchantress and any friendly units nearby.  Lasts 10 seconds.
fields.name: Nature's Attendants
fields.notes: Units with full HP will not be seleted for the heal. Can heal units with magic immunity.

fields.lore: A true steward of the forest, Aiushtha befriends all within it - from lowly trolls to powerful centaurs.
fields.description: Enchantress charms an enemy, bringing it under her control (if a creep) or slowing it (if a hero).
fields.name: Enchant
fields.notes: Illusions can be converted.

fields.lore: A true steward of the forest, Aiushtha befriends all within it - from lowly trolls to powerful centaurs.
fields.description: Enchantress charms an enemy, bringing it under her control (if a creep) or slowing it (if a hero).
fields.name: Enchant
fields.notes: Illusions can be converted.

fields.lore: While Aiushtha favors peaceful means, she is capable of a magical onslaught from a distance, her spears gaining energy from the natural life around her.
fields.description:
Places an enchantment on each attack while activated, causing it to deal additional damage based on how far away the target is.  The farther the target, the greater the damage dealt.

Impetus is a Unique Attack Modifier, and does not stack with other Unique Attack Modifiers.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Impetus
fields.notes: The damage is capped at 2500 distance. Distance to target is measured when the projectile hits.

fields.lore: After attacking Aiushtha, most opponents are overwhelmed with guilt having attacked such a natural beauty.
fields.description: Enchantress beguiles her enemies, slowing their attacks when she is attacked.  Lasts 3 seconds.
fields.name: Untouchable
fields.notes: All units who directly attack or cast spells on Enchantress will get slowed. The slow is applied on the attacking unit when the attack starts, not when damage is applied.

fields.lore: Pyrexae dragons have tremendously dangerous breath for each branch of the species; combining them is unimaginable.
fields.description: An icy blast followed by a wave of fire launches out in a path in front of Jakiro. The ice slows enemies, while the fire delivers damage over time.
fields.name: Dual Breath
fields.notes: Can hit units up to 950 range away. Has a 0.3 second interval between each breath.

fields.lore: Jakiro's cunning right head calls upon its frozen heritage, glazing the earth with blistering cold.
fields.description: Creates a path of ice that stuns and damages enemies that touch it.
fields.name: Ice Path
fields.notes: It takes 0.5 seconds for the path to reach its full extent.

fields.lore: Jakiro's cunning right head calls upon its frozen heritage, glazing the earth with blistering cold.
fields.description: Creates a path of ice that stuns and damages enemies that touch it.
fields.name: Ice Path
fields.notes: It takes 0.5 seconds for the path to reach its full extent.

fields.lore: The left maw of Jakiro opens, laying waste to any in its path.
fields.description: Jakiro burns his enemies in an area of effect with fire added to his attack, while slowing their attacks.
fields.name: Liquid Fire
fields.notes: Works on both units and buildings.

fields.lore: Jakiro's cunning right head calls upon its frozen heritage, glazing the earth with blistering cold.
fields.description: Creates a path of ice that stuns and damages enemies that touch it.
fields.name: Ice Path
fields.notes: It takes 0.5 seconds for the path to reach its full extent.

fields.lore: Ice and fire combine to rip the battlefield to shreds with extreme temperatures.
fields.description:
Jakiro lays down a line of flame in front of him, each dealing damage per second to enemy units in a wide area of effect.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Macropyre
fields.notes: Macropyre destroys trees in its path.

fields.lore: One of Clockwerk's inventions of which he is most proud is the power cog - though it is sometimes despised by his allies.
fields.description: Forms a barrier of energized cogs around Clockwerk, trapping any units that are near.  Enemies outside the trap that touch a cog are knocked back, losing health and mana. Once a cog has delivered a shock, it will power down.  Cogs can be destroyed by enemy attacks, but Clockwerk can destroy them with just one.
fields.name: Power Cogs
fields.notes: Cogs can shock invisible units.

fields.lore: What started as a festive display has become a useful scouting and bombardment tool.
fields.description: Fires a global range flare that explodes over a given area, damaging enemies and providing vision for 10 seconds.
fields.name: Rocket Flare

fields.lore: Some of Rattletrap's contraptions don't quite work correctly, so detonating them proves useful as an offensive maneuver.
fields.description: Discharges high-powered shrapnel at random nearby enemy units, dealing minor magical damage and ministun.
fields.name: Battery Assault
fields.notes: Deals damage every 0.7 seconds. Remains active if Clockwerk is disabled. Total damage: 240/560/880/1200

fields.lore: Some of Rattletrap's contraptions don't quite work correctly, so detonating them proves useful as an offensive maneuver.
fields.description: Discharges high-powered shrapnel at random nearby enemy units, dealing minor magical damage and ministun.
fields.name: Battery Assault

fields.notes: Deals damage every 0.7 seconds. Remains active if Clockwerk is disabled. Total damage: 240/560/880/1200

fields.lore: A somewhat unwieldy device, the Hookshot sends the otherwise clunky Clockwerk armor flying through the air.
fields.description:
Fires a grappling device rapidly at the target location.  If the hook hits a non-neutral unit, Clockwerk launches himself into the target, stunning and dealing damage.  Any enemies Clockwerk collides with along the way are subject to damage and stunned. 

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Hookshot
fields.notes: Hookshot will latch and take Clockwerk to allies, but not damage or disable them. Neutral creeps stop the hook with no effect.

fields.lore: Yurnero's renowned katana techniques are feared by warriors and sorcerors alike.
fields.description: Causes a bladestorm of destructive force around Juggernaut, rendering him immune to magic and dealing damage to nearby enemy units.  Lasts 5 seconds.
fields.name: Blade Fury
fields.notes: This skill doesn't affect mechanical units. You can use items during Blade Fury. If a unit is not being affected by Blade Fury, Juggernaut can perform normal attacks against this unit. Deals a total of 400/500/600/700 damage.

fields.lore: The last remnant of his heritage's commitment to bladework, Yurnero ensures that the style is remembered.
fields.description: Gives Juggernaut a chance to deal double damage on each attack.
fields.name: Blade Dance

fields.lore: Yurnero's renowned katana techniques are feared by warriors and sorcerors alike.
fields.description: Causes a bladestorm of destructive force around Juggernaut, rendering him immune to magic and dealing damage to nearby enemy units.  Lasts 5 seconds.
fields.name: Blade Fury
fields.notes: This skill doesn't affect mechanical units. You can use items during Blade Fury. If a unit is not being affected by Blade Fury, Juggernaut can perform normal attacks against this unit. Deals a total of 400/500/600/700 damage.

fields.lore: Of the rituals learned at the Isle of Masks, tending wounds with a bit of voodoo magic has proven to be quite useful.
fields.description: Summons a Healing Ward that heals all nearby allied units, based on their max hit points.  The Healing Ward can move at 450 movement speed after being summoned.  Lasts 25 seconds.
fields.name: Healing Ward
fields.notes: The healing ward can be controlled. Multiple healing wards don't stack.

fields.lore: Yurnero's renowned katana techniques are feared by warriors and sorcerors alike.
fields.description: Causes a bladestorm of destructive force around Juggernaut, rendering him immune to magic and dealing damage to nearby enemy units.  Lasts 5 seconds.
fields.name: Blade Fury
fields.notes: This skill doesn't affect mechanical units. You can use items during Blade Fury. If a unit is not being affected by Blade Fury, Juggernaut can perform normal attacks against this unit. Deals a total of 400/500/600/700 damage.

fields.lore: 'The fruits of discipline; with practice comes strength.'
fields.description:
Juggernaut leaps towards the target enemy unit with a damaging attack, and then slashes other nearby enemy units, dealing between 175-250 damage per slash.  Juggernaut is invulnerable for the duration.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Omnislash
fields.notes: Interrupts channeling spells of the primary target. Can target magic immune units. Slashes happen on an interval of 0.4 seconds. Creeps are killed in one hit of omnislash. You can use items during Omnislash.

fields.lore: Yurnero's renowned katana techniques are feared by warriors and sorcerors alike.
fields.description: Causes a bladestorm of destructive force around Juggernaut, rendering him immune to magic and dealing damage to nearby enemy units.  Lasts 5 seconds.
fields.name: Blade Fury
fields.notes: This skill doesn't affect mechanical units. You can use items during Blade Fury. If a unit is not being affected by Blade Fury, Juggernaut can perform normal attacks against this unit. Deals a total of 400/500/600/700 damage.

fields.lore: Of the rituals learned at the Isle of Masks, tending wounds with a bit of voodoo magic has proven to be quite useful.
fields.description: Summons a Healing Ward that heals all nearby allied units, based on their max hit points.  The Healing Ward can move at 450 movement speed after being summoned.  Lasts 25 seconds.
fields.name: Healing Ward
fields.notes: The healing ward can be controlled. Multiple healing wards don't stack.

fields.lore: The last remnant of his heritage's commitment to bladework, Yurnero ensures that the style is remembered.
fields.description: Gives Juggernaut a chance to deal double damage on each attack.

fields.lore: All zealot scarabs possess intimate knowledge of underground pathways, using them to their advantage.
fields.description: Rock spikes burst from the earth along a straight path. Enemy units are hurled into the air, then are stunned and take damage when they fall.
fields.name: Impale
fields.notes: The spikes move at 1600 units per second, over 700 range.

fields.lore: While their carapace is relatively thin, it's guarded by a retractable field of razor-sharp spikes.
fields.description: When activated, Spiked Carapace reflects and negates damage dealt to Nyx Assassin (max once from each source), as well as stunning the source of the damage.
fields.name: Spiked Carapace
fields.notes: The damage is calculated after all reductions. Spiked Carapace will only trigger on damage from other player controlled units.

fields.lore: All zealot scarabs possess intimate knowledge of underground pathways, using them to their advantage.

fields.name: Impale
fields.notes: The spikes move at 1600 units per second, over 700 range.

fields.lore: The tome in Ultimyr describes one scarab with the ability eat away at the mind of lesser beings.
fields.description: Destroys the target hero's mana equal to a multiplier of its Intelligence, and deals damage equal to the mana burned.
fields.name: Mana Burn

fields.lore: All zealot scarabs possess intimate knowledge of underground pathways, using them to their advantage.

fields.name: Impale
fields.notes: The spikes move at 1600 units per second, over 700 range.

fields.lore: The scarab kills for the glory of his queen.
fields.description: Allows Nyx Assassin to become invisible and gain a speed bonus.  If Nyx Assassin attacks to break the invisibility, massive bonus damage is dealt with the attack.
fields.name: Vendetta
fields.notes: Has a 0 second fadetime. If a spell is used to break the invisibility, or the invisibility expires, the bonus damage is lost.

fields.lore: Axe is the only reinforcement this army needs.
fields.description: When attacked, Axe performs a helix counter attack, dealing damage to all nearby enemies.
fields.name: Counter Helix
fields.notes: Counter Helix checks for triggering whenever an attack against Axe begins, not when Axe is actually damaged by said attack.

fields.lore: Ordinary heroes cannot withstand Mogul Khan's rage for battle, such that it injures them until it is satisfied.
fields.description: Enrages an enemy unit, causing it to be slowed and take damage over time until it kills another unit or the duration ends. Axe gains movement speed for each unit affected with Battle Hunger.
fields.name: Battle Hunger
fields.notes: Destroying buildings will also remove the debuff. Units affected by Battle Hunger cannot be denied.

fields.lore: Ordinary heroes cannot withstand Mogul Khan's rage for battle, such that it injures them until it is satisfied.

fields.name: Battle Hunger
fields.notes: Destroying buildings will also remove the debuff. Units affected by Battle Hunger cannot be denied.

fields.name: Counter Helix
fields.notes: Counter Helix checks for triggering whenever an attack against Axe begins, not when Axe is actually damaged by said attack.

fields.description: Enrages an enemy unit, causing it to be slowed and take damage over time until it kills another unit or the duration ends. Axe gains movement speed for each unit affected with Battle Hunger.
fields.name: Battle Hunger
fields.notes: Destroying buildings will also remove the debuff. Units affected by Battle Hunger cannot be denied.

fields.lore: Mogul Khan is the embodiment of battle and fury, launching into a gruesome fatality against those who dare engage the Axe in combat.
fields.description:
Axe spots weakness and strikes, dealing moderate damage but instantly killing an enemy unit with low health.  When an enemy hero is killed in this way, the cooldown is reset. Axe and nearby allied units gain bonus movement speed.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Culling Blade
fields.notes: The killing blow goes through magic immunity.

fields.lore: Mogul Khan's warcry taunts opponents into engaging in an unconquerable battle with the Axe.
fields.description: Axe taunts nearby enemy units, forcing them to attack him, while he gains bonus armor during the duration.
fields.name: Berserker's Call
fields.notes: Affects units with magic immunity.

fields.lore: Manipulating her psionic veil, Lanaya bends nature's law to her will.
fields.description: Templar Assassin becomes highly elusive, avoiding damage while gaining a bonus to her damage.  These effects are separate, and have a limited number of instances
fields.name: Refraction
fields.notes: Damage as HP Removal bypasses Refraction (it won't reduce the charges). The damage and block instances are separate. Only instances of 5 or more damage will trigger Refraction.

fields.lore: Her blades pierce the skin as much as the mind, furthering her understanding of the mystery that is reality.
fields.description: Templar Assassin's psi blades slice through the attacked unit, splitting and damaging enemy units directly behind it, while gaining bonus attack range.
fields.name: Psi Blades
fields.notes: Spill damage hits invisible units. Attack effects like Unique Attack Modifiers and Bash will only be applied to the main target. Attacks against illusions will not spill.

fields.lore: Manipulating her psionic veil, Lanaya bends nature's law to her will.
fields.description: Templar Assassin becomes highly elusive, avoiding damage while gaining a bonus to her damage.  These effects are separate, and have a limited number of instances
fields.name: Refraction
fields.notes: Damage as HP Removal bypasses Refraction (it won't reduce the charges). The damage and block instances are separate. Only instances of 5 or more damage will trigger Refraction.

fields.lore: Lanaya is as elusive as her covenant with the Hidden Temple.
fields.description: Templar Assassin conceals herself, gaining invisibility while remaining still.  On the next attacked enemy unit, Lanaya will reduce its armor and deal bonus damage to it.
fields.name: Meld
fields.notes: Meld is broken by any action other than staying in position. Doesn't work against towers.

fields.lore: Manipulating her psionic veil, Lanaya bends nature's law to her will.
fields.description: Templar Assassin becomes highly elusive, avoiding damage while gaining a bonus to her damage.  These effects are separate, and have a limited number of instances
fields.name: Refraction
fields.notes: Damage as HP Removal bypasses Refraction (it won't reduce the charges). The damage and block instances are separate. Only instances of 5 or more damage will trigger Refraction.

fields.lore: Calling upon the reach of the Hidden Temple, none escape the eye of the Templar.
fields.description: Templar Assassin places mystical traps that invisibly monitor enemy movement. When sprung, at her command, they exert a slowing influence of 30% in the area. Traps charge up to slow more by 5% for each second up to 50%.
fields.name: Psionic Trap
fields.notes: Traps last indefinitely. They have invisibility that fades in over 2 seconds, magic immunity, and 100 HP. Traps have 400/400 vision range and don't prevent neutral camps from spawning.

fields.lore: After escaping from his cell in Devarque, N'aix subsisted on flesh and bones of those unfortunate to cross his path.
fields.description: Regenerates a portion of the attacked enemy's current HP and deals the same portion of damage per attack.
fields.name: Feast
fields.notes: Does not affect Roshan. Affects magic immune units. The heal is independent of the damage. Stacks additively with other sources of Lifesteal.

fields.lore: The madness and brutality of N'aix makes him a vicious and unrelenting foe in combat.
fields.description: Launch into a maddened rage, becoming immune to magic spells and gaining increased attack speed.
fields.name: Rage
fields.notes: Upon casting, many buffs and debuffs will be removed.

fields.lore: After escaping from his cell in Devarque, N'aix subsisted on flesh and bones of those unfortunate to cross his path.
fields.description: Regenerates a portion of the attacked enemy's current HP and deals the same portion of damage per attack.
fields.name: Feast
fields.notes: Does not affect Roshan. Affects magic immune units. The heal is independent of the damage. Stacks additively with other sources of Lifesteal.

fields.lore: Fresh wounds and the scent of blood often draw out the scavengers to finish the job.
fields.description: Lifestealer rends an enemy unit, slowing the victim's movespeed and allowing all allies to lifesteal on that unit. All damage dealt will steal life, including damage from spells. The victim recovers movement speed over the duration.
fields.name: Open Wounds
fields.notes: Open Wounds slows over 8 different steps: 70% / 70% / 60% / 50% / 30% / 10% / 10% / 10%, with the slow decreasing one step per second. Stacks additively with other sources of Lifesteal.

fields.lore: After escaping from his cell in Devarque, N'aix subsisted on flesh and bones of those unfortunate to cross his path.
fields.description: Regenerates a portion of the attacked enemy's current HP and deals the same portion of damage per attack.
fields.name: Feast
fields.notes: Does not affect Roshan. Affects magic immune units. The heal is independent of the damage. Stacks additively with other sources of Lifesteal.

fields.lore: With this infestation, N'aix consumes the life blood of the host, restoring him back to full unholy power.
fields.description: Lifestealer will infest the body of the target unit, lying dormant and undetectable inside. When he reveals himself, he deals damage to all nearby enemy units. If the unit is a creep, he will devour it first, gaining health equal to the unit's current HP.  Does not work on enemy Heroes.
fields.name: Infest
fields.notes: If the infested unit dies before Lifestealer consumes it, no health is gained. Lifestealer gains experience while under the effects of Infest.

fields.lore: After escaping from his cell in Devarque, N'aix subsisted on flesh and bones of those unfortunate to cross his path.
fields.description: Regenerates a portion of the attacked enemy's current HP and deals the same portion of damage per attack.
fields.name: Feast
fields.notes: Does not affect Roshan. Affects magic immune units. The heal is independent of the damage. Stacks additively with other sources of Lifesteal.

fields.name: Open Wounds
fields.notes: Open Wounds slows over 8 different steps: 70% / 70% / 60% / 50% / 30% / 10% / 10% / 10%, with the slow decreasing one step per second. Stacks additively with other sources of Lifesteal.

fields.lore: The madness and brutality of N'aix makes him a vicious and unrelenting foe in combat.
fields.description: Launch into a maddened rage, becoming immune to magic spells and gaining increased attack speed.
fields.name: Rage
fields.notes: Upon casting, many buffs and debuffs will be removed.

fields.lore: It is with the power of a mountain that Earth Spirit strikes his enemies.
fields.description: Earth Spirit smashes the target enemy, ally, or Stone Remnant, knocking it back in the direction he is facing.  The knocked back target deals damage to all units it hits.  If the target was a Stone Remnant, damaged targets are also stunned, and the travel distance is improved.
fields.name: Boulder Smash
fields.notes: Stun is only applied if the initial target is a Stone Remnant.

fields.lore: Like calls to like. Even the minerals found in the blood and bones of living beings are not immune to the call of the Earth Spirit.
fields.description: Earth Spirit pulls the target allied unit or Stone Remnant to his location.  Enemies struck by the flying target will be silenced, and take damage if the flying target is a Stone Remnant.
fields.name: Geomagnetic Grip

fields.lore: Calling upon his connection to the land, the Earth Spirit draws loose stone to him, which forms a protective ball that he can use to roll short distances.
fields.description: After a 0.6s delay, Earth Spirit becomes a boulder, rolling towards the target position and damaging enemy units, stopping if he collides with an enemy hero or is stunned.  If the boulder rolls over a Stone Remnant, the Stone Remnant is consumed and travel distance and speed are improved, and impacted enemies have their movement and attack speed slowed.
fields.name: Rolling Boulder

fields.lore: It is with the power of a mountain that Earth Spirit strikes his enemies.
fields.description: Earth Spirit smashes the target enemy, ally, or Stone Remnant, knocking it back in the direction he is facing.  The knocked back target deals damage to all units it hits.  If the target was a Stone Remnant, damaged targets are also stunned, and the travel distance is improved.
fields.name: Boulder Smash
fields.notes: Stun is only applied if the initial target is a Stone Remnant.

fields.lore: Like calls to like. Even the minerals found in the blood and bones of living beings are not immune to the call of the Earth Spirit.
fields.description: Earth Spirit pulls the target allied unit or Stone Remnant to his location.  Enemies struck by the flying target will be silenced, and take damage if the flying target is a Stone Remnant.
fields.name: Geomagnetic Grip

fields.description: Magnetizes units in a small nearby area, causing them to take damage over time for a short duration. Any magnetized heroes cause nearby Stone Remnants to become energized and explode, applying/refreshing the magnetize debuff on all units near the Stone Remnant. This process can repeat multiple times. Stone Remnants are destroyed in this process.  If an enemy hero is affected by silence or slows as a result of Geomagnetic Grip or Rolling Boulder, all magnetized heroes share the effects.
fields.name: Magnetize

fields.lore: Calling upon his connection to the land, the Earth Spirit draws loose stone to him, which forms a protective ball that he can use to roll short distances.

If the boulder rolls over a Stone Remnant, the Stone Remnant is consumed and travel distance and speed are improved, and impacted enemies have their movement and attack speed slowed.

fields.lore: Time in the Dark Reef made Slark a dangerous assassin; aggressive and fearless.
fields.description: Slark leaps forward, grabbing the first hero he connects with.  That unit takes damage and is leashed to Slark, and can only move a limited distance away from Slark's landing position.
fields.name: Pounce
fields.notes: On cast, Slark leaps forward at a speed of 933.33, stopping when he latches onto an enemy hero or has traveled 700 distance. Magic immune units cannot be leashed. Trees will be destroyed around Slark's landing location. Blinking or teleporting can break the leash.

fields.lore: With each strike at his adversaries, Slark's knowledge of their weaknesses improves.
fields.description: Slark steals the life essence of enemy heroes with his attacks, draining each of their attributes and converting them to bonus Agility.
fields.name: Essence Shift
fields.notes: Attributes cannot be dropped below 1. When either Slark or the affected unit dies, the stats are returned to normal.

fields.lore: Slithereen are capable of quickly regrowing appendages, in case of critical injury, to save their own lives.
fields.description: After a short delay, Slark sacrifices some of his life blood, purging negative debuffs and dealing damage to enemy units around him and to himself.  Slark only takes 50% of the damage.
fields.name: Dark Pact
fields.notes: 1.5 seconds after cast, a series of 10 pulses separated by 0.1 seconds deal the damage. Each pulse also removes buffs from Slark. You can't kill yourself with this skill. The pulses stop if Slark dies.

fields.lore: Time in the Dark Reef made Slark a dangerous assassin; aggressive and fearless.
fields.description: Slark leaps forward, grabbing the first hero he connects with.  That unit takes damage and is leashed to Slark, and can only move a limited distance away from Slark's landing position.
fields.name: Pounce
fields.notes: On cast, Slark leaps forward at a speed of 933.33, stopping when he latches onto an enemy hero or has traveled 700 distance. Magic immune units cannot be leashed. Trees will be destroyed around Slark's landing location. Blinking or teleporting can break the leash.

fields.lore: Slithereen are capable of quickly regrowing appendages, in case of critical injury, to save their own lives.
fields.description: After a short delay, Slark sacrifices some of his life blood, purging negative debuffs and dealing damage to enemy units around him and to himself.  Slark only takes 50% of the damage.
fields.name: Dark Pact
fields.notes: 1.5 seconds after cast, a series of 10 pulses separated by 0.1 seconds deal the damage. Each pulse also removes buffs from Slark. You can't kill yourself with this skill. The pulses stop if Slark dies.

fields.lore: The hidden Thirteenth is a slippery foe.
fields.description: When used, Slark hides himself in a cloud of shadows, becoming immune to detection (attacking, casting spells, and using items do not reveal Slark).  Passively, when not visible to the enemy team, Slark gains bonus movement speed and health regeneration.
fields.name: Shadow Dance
fields.notes: If Slark is damaged by a neutral unit, the effect is lost for 2 seconds.

fields.lore: Although they may not be knights, Chen incorporates beasts into the Fold in the same way he himself was converted.
fields.description: Gives control of an enemy or neutral creep, and gives it bonus hit points.
fields.name: Holy Persuasion
fields.notes: You can take control of only non-Ancient type creeps. When persuading a new creep above your max unit count, the oldest persuaded unit will die.

fields.lore: Knights of the Fold possess a fanatical form of magic that is considered quite unwieldy by most other users of arcane arts.
fields.description: Deals random damage to test an enemy unit's faith.
fields.name: Test of Faith

fields.lore: Although they may not be knights, Chen incorporates beasts into the Fold in the same way he himself was converted.
fields.description: Gives control of an enemy or neutral creep, and gives it bonus hit points.
fields.name: Holy Persuasion
fields.notes: You can take control of only non-Ancient type creeps. When persuading a new creep above your max unit count, the oldest persuaded unit will die.

fields.lore: Knights of the Fold possess a fanatical form of magic that is considered quite unwieldy by most other users of arcane arts.
fields.description: Deals random damage to test an enemy unit's faith.
fields.name: Test of Faith

fields.lore: Although they may not be knights, Chen incorporates beasts into the Fold in the same way he himself was converted.
fields.description: Gives control of an enemy or neutral creep, and gives it bonus hit points.
fields.name: Holy Persuasion
fields.notes: You can take control of only non-Ancient type creeps. When persuading a new creep above your max unit count, the oldest persuaded unit will die.

fields.lore: Using the mental link with his thralls, Chen calls down restoration and well-being to those who share his fanaticism.
fields.description:
Fully regenerates any creeps under Chen's control and heals all allied heroes on the map.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Hand of God
fields.notes: Heals magic immune units.

fields.lore: Although Chen's brand of animal enthrallment isn't quite strong enough to control the minds of enemy heroes, it still tests their resolve in combat.
fields.description: Forces an enemy unit to move slower and take more damage from attacks and spells.
fields.name: Penitence
fields.notes: Bonus damage will always be physical (reduced by armor), regardless of the damage source.

fields.lore: Although they may not be knights, Chen incorporates beasts into the Fold in the same way he himself was converted.
fields.description: Gives control of an enemy or neutral creep, and gives it bonus hit points.
fields.name: Holy Persuasion
fields.notes: You can take control of only non-Ancient type creeps. When persuading a new creep above your max unit count, the oldest persuaded unit will die.

fields.description: Teleports a friendly unit back to the base.  Creeps are teleported instantly, Heroes have a delay before teleporting.
fields.name: Test of Faith

fields.lore: Although Chen's brand of animal enthrallment isn't quite strong enough to control the minds of enemy heroes, it still tests their resolve in combat.
fields.description: Forces an enemy unit to move slower and take more damage from attacks and spells.
fields.name: Penitence
fields.notes: Bonus damage will always be physical (reduced by armor), regardless of the damage source.

fields.lore: A simple Skywrath technique, the magic missile is Shendel's primary tool for vengeance.
fields.description: Fires a magic missile at an enemy unit, stunning and dealing damage.
fields.name: Magic Missile

fields.lore: Although they may not share her undying passion for revenge, allies do draw on her fanaticism in combat.
fields.description: Vengeful Spirit's presence increases nearby friendly units' physical damage.
fields.name: Vengeance Aura
fields.notes: The bonus damage provided by the aura is based on base damage and primary attribute.

fields.lore: A simple Skywrath technique, the magic missile is Shendel's primary tool for vengeance.
fields.description: Fires a magic missile at an enemy unit, stunning and dealing damage.
fields.name: Magic Missile

fields.lore: A simple Skywrath technique, the magic missile is Shendel's primary tool for vengeance.
fields.description: Fires a magic missile at an enemy unit, stunning and dealing damage.
fields.name: Magic Missile

fields.lore: Martyrdom is a small price to pay for vengeance.
fields.description:
Instantaneously swaps positions with a target Hero, friend or enemy.  Nether Swap interrupts channeling abilities on the target.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Nether Swap
fields.notes: Works on magic immune units. Trees near Vengeful Spirit and the target will be destroyed when the spell is cast.

fields.lore: A simple Skywrath technique, the magic missile is Shendel's primary tool for vengeance.
fields.description: Fires a magic missile at an enemy unit, stunning and dealing damage.
fields.name: Magic Missile

fields.lore: Although they may not share her undying passion for revenge, allies do draw on her fanaticism in combat.
fields.description: Vengeful Spirit's presence increases nearby friendly units' physical damage.
fields.name: Vengeance Aura
fields.notes: The bonus damage provided by the aura is based on base damage and primary attribute.

fields.lore: Although they may not share her undying passion for revenge, allies do draw on her fanaticism in combat.
fields.description: Vengeful Spirit's presence increases nearby friendly units' physical damage.
fields.name: Vengeance Aura
fields.notes: The bonus damage provided by the aura is based on base damage and primary attribute.

fields.lore: Shendel's haunting voice hints at her approaching vindication.
fields.description: Vengeful Spirit lets loose a wicked cry, weakening the armor of enemies and giving vision of the path.
fields.name: Wave of Terror

fields.lore: A foul odor precedes a toxic, choking gas, emanating from the Butcher's putrid, ever-swelling mass.
fields.description: A toxic cloud that deals intense damage and slows movement--harming not only enemy units but Pudge himself.
fields.name: Rot
fields.notes: Using Rot doesn't interrupt channeling. Rot hits invisible units. If Pudge is silenced, he can't deactivate Rot if it's activated. Pudge can deny himself with this ability.

fields.lore: The Butcher's hook is a symbolic nightmare, its curved blade a frightening reminder of his slaughterous intent.
fields.description: Launches a bloody hook at a unit or location. The hook will snag the first unit it encounters, dragging the unit back to Pudge and dealing damage if it is an enemy.
fields.name: Meat Hook
fields.notes: Interrupts channeling spells of the primary target if it's an enemy. Meat Hook hits invisible units. Meat Hook can go through trees, cliffs, buildings, and mechanical units. Meat Hook can drag friendly units, but they won't be damaged.

fields.notes: Interrupts channeling spells of the primary target if it's an enemy. Meat Hook hits invisible units. Meat Hook can go through trees, cliffs, buildings, and mechanical units. Meat Hook can drag friendly units, but they won't be damaged.

fields.lore: 'When I'm through with these vermin, they'll be fit for a pie!'
fields.description:
CHANNELED - Pudge chows down on an enemy unit, disabling it and dealing damage over time. Lasts 3 seconds on Heroes, 6 seconds on creeps.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Dismember
fields.notes: Dismember will disable magic immune units, but not damage them. If a unit becomes invisible while Dismembered, it will still be under the effects of Dismember.

fields.lore: The Butcher gives new meaning to the words 'meat shield.'
fields.description: Gives Pudge resistance to magic damage, as well as bonus strength that increases each time Pudge kills an enemy Hero or it dies in his vicinity.  Flesh Heap is retroactive, meaning it can gain charges before it is skilled, which then become active.
fields.name: Flesh Heap
fields.notes: Stacks multiplicatively with other spell resistance sources.

fields.lore: 'When I'm through with these vermin, they'll be fit for a pie!'
fields.description:

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Dismember
fields.notes: Dismember will disable magic immune units, but not damage them. If a unit becomes invisible while Dismembered, it will still be under the effects of Dismember.

fields.lore: Crixalis often lies in wait, burrowing under the surface to ambush his adversaries.
fields.description: Sand King burrows into the ground and tunnels forward, damaging and stunning enemy units above him as he resurfaces.
fields.name: Burrowstrike

fields.lore: Some say Crixalis is a mirage; his carapace appearing then vanishing between the whirling sands of the Scintillant Waste.
fields.description: CHANNELED - Sand King creates a fearsome sandstorm that damages enemy units while hiding him from vision.  The invisibility remains for a short duration after the sandstorm ends.
fields.name: Sand Storm
fields.notes: Sand Storm can be used to dodge projectiles.

fields.lore: Crixalis often lies in wait, burrowing under the surface to ambush his adversaries.
fields.description: Sand King burrows into the ground and tunnels forward, damaging and stunning enemy units above him as he resurfaces.
fields.name: Burrowstrike

fields.lore: Some say Crixalis is a mirage; his carapace appearing then vanishing between the whirling sands of the Scintillant Waste.

fields.notes: Sand Storm can be used to dodge projectiles.

fields.lore: Crixalis often lies in wait, burrowing under the surface to ambush his adversaries.
fields.description: Sand King burrows into the ground and tunnels forward, damaging and stunning enemy units above him as he resurfaces.
fields.name: Burrowstrike

fields.lore: Many an explorer was lost to the quicksands of the Scintillant Waste.
fields.description:
CHANNELED - After channeling for 2 seconds, Sand King sends a disturbance into the earth, causing it to shudder violently. All enemies caught within range will take damage and become slowed. Each subsequent pulse increases the radius of damage dealt.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Epicenter
fields.notes: The pulses are centered on Sand King, not where he first casted the spell. The pulses have gradually inreasing radius: 275 / 325 / 375 / 425 / 475 / 525 / 575 / 650 / 675 / 700 ( 775 / 825 *).

fields.lore: Crixalis often lies in wait, burrowing under the surface to ambush his adversaries.
fields.description: Sand King burrows into the ground and tunnels forward, damaging and stunning enemy units above him as he resurfaces.
fields.name: Burrowstrike

fields.name: Sand Storm
fields.notes: Sand Storm can be used to dodge projectiles.

fields.name: Sand Storm

fields.lore: An injection from Crixalis makes one brittle and as dry as the arid wastes, subject to implosive demise.
fields.description:
Sand King's attacks inject a venom that causes enemy units to explode violently upon death, spreading area damage.

Caustic Finale is a Unique Attack Modifier, and does not stack with other Unique Attack Modifier.
fields.name: Caustic Finale
fields.notes: Units afflicted with the debuff will explode even if Sand King did not deliver the killing blow. The buff is not placed on allied units.

fields.lore: Verodicia bestowed the Prophet with the ability to summon the Treant Guard, a mythical sentient army of the wild.
fields.description: Converts an area of trees into Treants. Treants have 550 hit points and deal 21-23 damage.
fields.name: Nature's Call
fields.notes: Nature's Call can only create as many trees there are in the target area. Treants have 20% magic resistance.

fields.lore: The Prophet keeps his sentinel over the forest, protecting it when in need.
fields.description: Teleports to any point on the map.
fields.name: Teleportation
fields.notes: Teleport takes 3 seconds to cast. Mana and cooldown take effect when the cast is completed.  Nature's Prophet will not use any mana or waste the cooldown if the spell is interrupted while casting. When the cast begins, an effect is created at the target location, which is visible to allies and enemies.

fields.lore: Verodicia bestowed the Prophet with the ability to summon the Treant Guard, a mythical sentient army of the wild.
fields.description: Converts an area of trees into Treants. Treants have 550 hit points and deal 21-23 damage.
fields.name: Nature's Call
fields.notes: Nature's Call can only create as many trees there are in the target area. Treants have 20% magic resistance.

fields.lore: Verdant overgrowth is a common ailment reported by Nature's Prophet's attackers.
fields.description: Sprouts a ring of trees around a unit, trapping it in place.
fields.name: Sprout
fields.notes: Sprout can be cast on any unit, or the ground. Trees created by Sprout have the same interactions with abilities as regular trees.

fields.lore: Verodicia bestowed the Prophet with the ability to summon the Treant Guard, a mythical sentient army of the wild.

fields.name: Nature's Call
fields.notes: Nature's Call can only create as many trees there are in the target area. Treants have 20% magic resistance.

fields.lore: Nature's Prophet calls Verodicia's fury to strike down those who might ravage the wilderness.
fields.description:
Damaging energy bounces around the map, striking enemies close to the cast point that are in vision. Each enemy hit beyond the first adds damage.

Upgradable with Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Wrath of Nature
fields.notes: Wrath of Nature will not hit units out of vision. Can be cast through the minimap; the nearest valid target will be selected.

fields.lore: Sometimes breaking one of the Riftshadow Crystals can be just the trick for getting yourself out of a bind.  Or your other self.
fields.description: Drawing mystical energies from the earth, a Meepo can teleport to another Meepo or itself after channeling for 1.5 seconds, dealing damage in both the departure and arrival locations.
fields.name: Poof
fields.notes: Can be cast through the minimap. Can teleport to Meepo illusions.

fields.lore: Catching dinner in the Riftshadow Ruins can be quite the task.
fields.description: Tosses a net at the target point, pinning down all enemy units.  Earthbind prevents invisibility, blink, and interrupts channeling.
fields.name: Earthbind
fields.notes: While preventing units from going invisible, Earthbind won't hit units that are already invisible. Does not work on magic immune units or Roshan.

fields.lore: Do I know you?
fields.description:
Meepo summons an imperfect, semi-autonomous duplicate of himself, which can gain gold and experience as he does and shares his experience and abilities. However, the clones cannot wield any items but the boots that Meepo himself wears.  If any of the clones die, they all die. Increases the speed at which you respawn. 

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Divided We Stand
fields.notes: Clones can't use Arcane Boots or pick up runes.

fields.lore: Sometimes breaking one of the Riftshadow Crystals can be just the trick for getting yourself out of a bind.  Or your other self.
fields.description: Drawing mystical energies from the earth, a Meepo can teleport to another Meepo or itself after channeling for 1.5 seconds, dealing damage in both the departure and arrival locations.
fields.name: Poof
fields.notes: Can be cast through the minimap. Can teleport to Meepo illusions.

fields.name: Poof
fields.notes: Can be cast through the minimap. Can teleport to Meepo illusions.

fields.notes: Can be cast through the minimap. Can teleport to Meepo illusions.

fields.lore: Keeping your pack light and having few but versatile tools is the best bet for survival.
fields.description: Meepo enchants his weapon to deal damage per second, as well as slow the movement speed of the attacked unit.  Geostrikes from multiple Meepos stack.
fields.name: Geostrike
fields.notes: Slows magic immune units.

fields.lore: Catching dinner in the Riftshadow Ruins can be quite the task.
fields.description: Tosses a net at the target point, pinning down all enemy units.  Earthbind prevents invisibility, blink, and interrupts channeling.
fields.name: Earthbind
fields.notes: While preventing units from going invisible, Earthbind won't hit units that are already invisible. Does not work on magic immune units or Roshan.

fields.lore: Do I know you?
fields.description:
Meepo summons an imperfect, semi-autonomous duplicate of himself, which can gain gold and experience as he does and shares his experience and abilities. However, the clones cannot wield any items but the boots that Meepo himself wears.  If any of the clones die, they all die. Increases the speed at which you respawn. 

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Divided We Stand
fields.notes: Clones can't use Arcane Boots or pick up runes.

fields.lore: Catching dinner in the Riftshadow Ruins can be quite the task.

fields.name: Earthbind

fields.lore: Keeping your pack light and having few but versatile tools is the best bet for survival.
fields.description: Meepo enchants his weapon to deal damage per second, as well as slow the movement speed of the attacked unit.  Geostrikes from multiple Meepos stack.
fields.name: Geostrike
fields.notes: Slows magic immune units.

fields.lore: Keeping your pack light and having few but versatile tools is the best bet for survival.

fields.lore: An enforcer's honor can be a prickly thing.  So can his quills.
fields.description: Sprays enemy units with quills dealing damage in an area of effect around Bristleback.  Deals bonus damage for every time a unit was hit by Quill Spray in the last 14 seconds.
fields.name: Quill Spray
fields.notes: Quill Spray damage is not reduced by damage block abilities.

fields.lore: Turning his back to a fight might be just the thing.
fields.description: Bristleback takes less damage if hit on the sides or rear.  If Bristleback takes 250 damage from the rear, he releases a Quill Spray of the current level.
fields.name: Bristleback
fields.notes: Bristleback's rear is considered to be within 70 degrees from the back. Bristleback's side is considered to be within 110 degrees from the back.

fields.lore: An enforcer's honor can be a prickly thing.  So can his quills.
fields.description: Sprays enemy units with quills dealing damage in an area of effect around Bristleback.  Deals bonus damage for every time a unit was hit by Quill Spray in the last 14 seconds.
fields.name: Quill Spray
fields.notes: Quill Spray damage is not reduced by damage block abilities.

fields.lore: Having caught a cold while stuck in the snow, Bristleback turns it to his advantage.
fields.description: Covers a target in snot, causing it to have reduced armor and movement speed.  Multiple casts stack and refresh the duration.
fields.name: Viscous Nasal Goo

fields.lore: An enforcer's honor can be a prickly thing.  So can his quills.
fields.description: Sprays enemy units with quills dealing damage in an area of effect around Bristleback.  Deals bonus damage for every time a unit was hit by Quill Spray in the last 14 seconds.
fields.name: Quill Spray
fields.notes: Quill Spray damage is not reduced by damage block abilities.

fields.lore: 'Temper, temper,' his mum always chided.  But in a fight, a temper can come in handy.
fields.description: Bristleback works himself up into a fury every time he casts a spell, increasing his movement speed and damage.  The first stack (base) provides larger bonuses.
fields.name: Warpath
fields.notes: Bristleback's illusions will receive the bonuses. Items will not trigger Warpath.

fields.lore: Enigma is capable of drawing aspects of himself from other dimensions - the result is a trio of dark eidolons that hunt the corporeal plane.
fields.description: Transforms a creep into three fragments of Engima himself.  These eidolons are all under Enigma's control, and repeated successful attacks cause them to multiply.  When this happens, the eidolons have their health restored.
fields.name: Demonic Conversion
fields.notes: Converted enemy units will give gold bounty and experience.

fields.lore: Strange gravities pull at the core of those who would oppose you, holding them in place.
fields.description: Focuses Enigma's power on a target, causing it to take damage and become repeatedly stunned for multiple instances.  An instance strikes every 2 seconds.
fields.name: Malefice

fields.lore: Enigma is capable of drawing aspects of himself from other dimensions - the result is a trio of dark eidolons that hunt the corporeal plane.

fields.name: Demonic Conversion

fields.lore: The ground trembles as Enigma channels his ultimate vortex of destruction, a singularity with the power to end worlds.
fields.description:
CHANNELED - Summons a vortex that sucks in nearby enemy units.  Enemies affected by Black Hole cannot move, attack, or cast spells.  The closer units get to the center, the more damage is dealt.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Black Hole
fields.notes: Disables enemies through magic immunity.

fields.lore: A section of the world slowly descends into the void.
fields.description: Steeps an area in dark resonance, damaging enemy units based on their max HP.
fields.name: Midnight Pulse
fields.notes: Damage goes through magic immunity. This ability destroys trees in its area.

fields.lore: Ice-encased arrows pierce the silence, chilling their victims to the core.
fields.description:
Adds a freezing effect to Drow's attacks, slowing enemy movement.  Lasts 1.5 seconds on Heroes, and 7 seconds on creeps.

Frost Arrows is a Unique Attack Modifier, and does not stack with other Unique Attack Modifier.
fields.name: Frost Arrows
fields.notes: The slow duration is refreshed on successive casts.

fields.lore: Traxex' time spent alone in the forests of her Drow home has allowed her to teach other archers how to improve their bow skills.
fields.description: Adds bonus damage to the physical attack of allied Hero units on the map based on a percentage of Drow's agility.  Affects creeps for 30 seconds when cast.
fields.name: Precision Aura

fields.lore: The Drow Ranger is the epitome of archery prowess.
fields.description: Drow's experiences in battle improve her accuracy and effectiveness in combat, providing a passive bonus to Agility. Grants no bonus if there are enemy heroes within a 400 AoE.
fields.name: Marksmanship

fields.lore: Traxex is rather fond of the tranquility of physical combat, calling on her Drow heritage to end the incantations of opposing magi.
fields.description: Releases a wave that silences and knocks back enemy units. Knockback distance is relative to how close they are to you.
fields.name: Gust

fields.lore: One of Clockwerk's inventions of which he is most proud is the power cog - though it is sometimes despised by his allies.
fields.description: Forms a barrier of energized cogs around Clockwerk, trapping any units that are near.  Enemies outside the trap that touch a cog are knocked back, losing health and mana. Once a cog has delivered a shock, it will power down.  Cogs can be destroyed by enemy attacks, but Clockwerk can destroy them with just one.
fields.name: Power Cogs
fields.notes: Cogs can shock invisible units.

fields.lore: Some of Rattletrap's contraptions don't quite work correctly, so detonating them proves useful as an offensive maneuver.
fields.description: Discharges high-powered shrapnel at random nearby enemy units, dealing minor magical damage and ministun.
fields.name: Battery Assault
fields.notes: Deals damage every 0.7 seconds. Remains active if Clockwerk is disabled. Total damage: 240/560/880/1200

fields.lore: Some of Rattletrap's contraptions don't quite work correctly, so detonating them proves useful as an offensive maneuver.
fields.description: Discharges high-powered shrapnel at random nearby enemy units, dealing minor magical damage and ministun.
fields.name: Battery Assault
fields.notes: Deals damage every 0.7 seconds. Remains active if Clockwerk is disabled. Total damage: 240/560/880/1200

fields.lore: What started as a festive display has become a useful scouting and bombardment tool.
fields.description: Fires a global range flare that explodes over a given area, damaging enemies and providing vision for 10 seconds.
fields.name: Rocket Flare

fields.lore: Some of Rattletrap's contraptions don't quite work correctly, so detonating them proves useful as an offensive maneuver.
fields.description: Discharges high-powered shrapnel at random nearby enemy units, dealing minor magical damage and ministun.
fields.name: Battery Assault
fields.notes: Deals damage every 0.7 seconds. Remains active if Clockwerk is disabled. Total damage: 240/560/880/1200

fields.lore: A somewhat unwieldy device, the Hookshot sends the otherwise clunky Clockwerk armor flying through the air.
fields.description:
Fires a grappling device rapidly at the target location.  If the hook hits a non-neutral unit, Clockwerk launches himself into the target, stunning and dealing damage.  Any enemies Clockwerk collides with along the way are subject to damage and stunned. 

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Hookshot
fields.notes: Hookshot will latch and take Clockwerk to allies, but not damage or disable them. Neutral creeps stop the hook with no effect.

fields.description: Allows manipulation of ice elements and grants a permanent strength bonus. Each Quas instance provides increased health regeneration.
fields.name: Quas
fields.notes: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.

fields.lore: So begins a new age of knowledge.
fields.description:
Combines the properties of the elements currently being manipulated, creating a new spell at the Invoker's disposal. Click the help button to see the list of possible spells.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Invoke
fields.notes: The arrangement of instances does not matter.

fields.lore: The Ancient Apparition's eternal knowledge brings a frigid enchantment to his allies.
fields.description: A frigid gust enchants allied heroes, granting them bonus magical damage for a given number of physical attacks, while slowing their attack speed slightly.  Ancient Apparition always receives the buff. Lasts 30 seconds.
fields.name: Chilling Touch
fields.notes: Extra damage is its own instance of damage. Only works against heroes and creeps.

fields.lore: Kaldr's presence draws those around him into a frozen void, threatening to lock them in an icy prison for eternity.
fields.description: Places a frozen hex on an enemy unit that deals damage over time, but can be dispelled by moving away from the initial cast point.  If the enemy unit doesn't move outside of the given range, it will be stunned and frozen in place after 4 seconds.
fields.name: Cold Feet
fields.notes: Total possible damage: 150/200/250/300. Deals damage every 0.8 seconds.

fields.lore: Kaldr's presence draws those around him into a frozen void, threatening to lock them in an icy prison for eternity.
fields.description: Places a frozen hex on an enemy unit that deals damage over time, but can be dispelled by moving away from the initial cast point.  If the enemy unit doesn't move outside of the given range, it will be stunned and frozen in place after 4 seconds.
fields.name: Cold Feet
fields.notes: Total possible damage: 150/200/250/300. Deals damage every 0.8 seconds.

fields.lore: Frozen, caustic winds are at the whim of Kaldr, chilling the field of battle.
fields.description: Creates a vortex of icy energy that slows movement speed and increases magic damage done in its range.  Lasts 16 seconds.
fields.name: Ice Vortex
fields.notes: Doesn't affect magic immune units.

fields.lore: Kaldr's presence draws those around him into a frozen void, threatening to lock them in an icy prison for eternity.
fields.description: Places a frozen hex on an enemy unit that deals damage over time, but can be dispelled by moving away from the initial cast point.  If the enemy unit doesn't move outside of the given range, it will be stunned and frozen in place after 4 seconds.
fields.name: Cold Feet
fields.notes: Total possible damage: 150/200/250/300. Deals damage every 0.8 seconds.

fields.lore: Ice storms from ages past flow through Kaldr's frosty limbs, crashing into the world and turning its inhabitants into monuments to his eternal power.
fields.description:
An explosive ball of icy hail that can be used to strike targets anywhere on the map. On first use, Kaldr launches a tracer towards the targeted location.  The second use marks the current location of the blast, upon which the actual projectile is launched - the greater the distance, the larger the radius affected. It deals damage to enemy units and applies a frostbite curse to units in and around the area that prevents regeneration or healing. Frostbitten units will take minor damage over time; if the units drop below a certain percentage of hitpoints, they'll instantly shatter.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Ice Blast
fields.notes: The area of effect is 275 + 50*TimeTraveled, capped at 1000.  The freeze area along the path is 275. Kill will be granted to the source of the damage that triggers the shatter. The instant kill doesn't work on illusions or Meepo clones. The HP Freeze prevents most kinds of healing, including the fountain. The frozen debuff can be purged.

fields.lore: In his encounter with the Dead Gods, Anti-Mage learned the value of being elusive.
fields.description: Short distance teleportation that allows Anti-Mage to move in and out of combat.
fields.name: Blink
fields.notes: If you used Blink to teleport to a distance over the maximum range, you'll be teleported 4/5 of the maximum range instead. You can use Blink to dodge incoming projectiles.

fields.lore: A modified technique of the Turstarkuri monks' peaceful ways is to turn magical energies on their owner.
fields.description:
Burns an opponent's mana on each attack.  Mana Break deals 60% of the mana burned as damage to the target.

Mana Break is a Unique Attack Modifier, and does not stack with other Unique Attack Modifiers.
fields.name: Mana Break
fields.notes: Mana Burn is blocked by magic immunity. You can lifeleech the damage dealt by this skill with a Lifesteal aura.

fields.lore: A modified technique of the Turstarkuri monks' peaceful ways is to turn magical energies on their owner.
fields.description:

Mana Break is a Unique Attack Modifier, and does not stack with other Unique Attack Modifiers.
fields.name: Mana Break
fields.notes: Mana Burn is blocked by magic immunity. You can lifeleech the damage dealt by this skill with a Lifesteal aura.

fields.lore: Years of meditation and obsession with revenge have hardened Anti-Mage's skin against mystical opponents.
fields.description: Increases Anti-Mage's resistance to magic damage.
fields.name: Spell Shield
fields.notes: Stacks multiplicatively with other spell resistance sources.

fields.lore: A modified technique of the Turstarkuri monks' peaceful ways is to turn magical energies on their owner.
fields.description:

fields.lore: After bringing enemies to their knees, Anti-Mage punishes them for their use of the arcane arts.
fields.description: For each point of mana missing by the target unit, damage is dealt to it and surrounding enemies.  The main target is also mini-stunned.
fields.name: Mana Void
fields.notes: The stun passes through magic immunity. Damage is calculated based on the primary target's mana, but applied to all enemies within the area of effect.

fields.lore: A self-defense incantation, Rhasta developed shackles after his master was slain in the Bleeding Hills.
fields.description: CHANNELED - Magically binds an enemy unit so that it cannot move or attack, while dealing damage over time.
fields.name: Shackles

fields.lore: Rhasta often ended performances by turning himself into a chicken - now, the humiliation is shared.
fields.description: Transforms an enemy unit into a harmless creature, disabling their attacks and abilities.
fields.name: Hex
fields.notes: Instantly destroys illusions. The target will have a base movement speed of 100, but buffs granting maximum movement speed won't be disabled. Hex disables damage block and evasion.

fields.lore: Rhasta often ended performances by turning himself into a chicken - now, the humiliation is shared.
fields.description: Transforms an enemy unit into a harmless creature, disabling their attacks and abilities.
fields.name: Hex
fields.notes: Instantly destroys illusions. The target will have a base movement speed of 100, but buffs granting maximum movement speed won't be disabled. Hex disables damage block and evasion.

fields.lore: A self-defense incantation, Rhasta developed shackles after his master was slain in the Bleeding Hills.
fields.description: CHANNELED - Magically binds an enemy unit so that it cannot move or attack, while dealing damage over time.
fields.name: Shackles

fields.lore: Snake charming was a big part of the Shadow Shaman's act; now Rhasta can empower the snakes to do his bidding.
fields.description:
Summons 10 serpent wards to attack enemy units and structures. The wards are immune to magic, and have a small area of splash damage that increases per level.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Mass Serpent Ward
fields.notes: Serpent Wards deal piercing type splash damage. Serpent Wards deal 100% damage in a 50/75/85 radius. Serpent Wards deal 40% damage in a 75/100/110 radius. Serpent Wards deal 20% damage in a 150/200/220 radius.

fields.lore: Originally used to open shows with the travelling con-man, Rhasta's lightning display shocks adversaries in more ways than one.
fields.description: Creates a cone of ethereal energy that strikes multiple enemy units.
fields.name: Ether Shock
fields.notes: Can hit secondary targets up to 1000 distance away.

fields.lore: Harvested souls swirl in and out of the Abysm, empowering the Shadow Fiend to increase the size of his collection.
fields.description: Shadow Fiend steals the soul from units he kills, gaining bonus damage. If the killed unit is a hero, he gains 12 souls.  On death, he releases half of them from bondage.
fields.name: Necromastery
fields.notes: Denies, neutral creeps, and buildings also provide bonus damage through Necromastery.

fields.lore: Nevermore's trademark for harvesting souls.
fields.description: Shadow Fiend razes the area in front of him, dealing damage to enemy units in an area.
fields.name: Shadowraze

fields.name: Shadowraze

fields.lore: The captured souls of those past slain are released to ravage their former allies.
fields.description: Captured souls are used to deal massive damage, as well as slowing and reducing the attack damage of nearby enemy units. Requiem of Souls creates one wave of damage for every 2 souls stored by Necromastery.  The closest enemy units are hit the hardest.  Requiem has a 1 second cast time before it is activated.  Requiem of Souls is automatically cast when Shadow Fiend dies, independent of its cooldown.
fields.name: Requiem of Souls
fields.notes: One line is generated around Nevermore, 1 per 2 souls, for a maximum of 18 lines.

fields.lore: Even being near Nevermore eats away at one's soul.
fields.description: Shadow Fiend's presence reduces the armor of nearby enemies.
fields.name: Presence of the Dark Lord
fields.notes: Stacks fully with other armor reduction abilities and aura.
